chunk.textFormat: If you have changed a wheel on a car, you probably know that the wheel nuts must be tightening in some order. While tightening with numbers of screws (e.g. cylinder head) stresses are spread on a surface. If we screw correctly a chance of warp appears. So called cross sequence screwing must be applied.

For the cylinder head on e.g. D13 we have this tightening order.
As you can see, we are tightening from the centre and out in order not to jam the gasket.

Go through the information in the document “Additional information”, headline “Screw tightening order according to a schedule”.
Trainer can first show how to tighten in correct order on a camshaft or on a cylinder head. Let also the participants do this exercise.
This information can be different depending on which engine you are working on. Print out the correct information to the participants from Impact.
